concept.definition: The variable is dichotomous, such as present or absent.
The variable is a continuous result such as a quantity.
The variable is described narratively rather than quantitatively.

description: The possible types of variables for exposures or outcomes (E.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, Descriptive).
name: EvidenceVariableType

text.div:
EvidenceVariableType

The possible types of variables for exposures or outcomes (E.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, Descriptive).

This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/variable-type defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
dichotomous DichotomousThe variable is dichotomous, such as present or absent.
continuous ContinuousThe variable is a continuous result such as a quantity.
descriptive DescriptiveThe variable is described narratively rather than quantitatively.

title: EvidenceVariableType
